title: Resume
text:
ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENTIST specialized in climate and ecosystem science, greenhouse gas inventory and accounting, and implementation of sustainable strategies to preserve human and wildlife well-being. Dedicated to advancing environmental risk management and global equitable development through corporate sustainability. Skilled in project management, data analysis, and science communication, with practical field, lab, and interagency collaboration experience.
Technical Toolkit:  

Data analysis:  R, OpenLCA, DAYCENT, ArcGIS Pro, and Associates Certificates in Microsoft Word and Excel (2019 Microsoft Office).
Communication: Scientific Writing, Public Communication in Natural Resources, Visual Literacy, and Leadership. Certified as a Project Learning Tree K-8 Environmental Educator. 
Sustainability Analysis: Life Cycle Assessment for Sustainability (2006 ISO 14040 and 14044 based), Greenhouse Gas Inventories (IPCC 2006 Guideline-based), Scope 1, 2, and 3 Greenhouse Gas Accounting Strategies.  
Field Sampling: Air Sampling with SKC Biosamplers, Standardized Wildlife Protocols, and Habitat Suitability Analysis.

title: Resume
text:
Project Management & Research Experience

Monarch Butterfly Conservation and Environmental Education ᐧ Environment for the Americas ᐧ Fort Carson Army Base, Colorado Springs, CO ᐧ Jul-Aug 2025

Conducted over 30 intensive and systematic monarch butterfly and bumble bee surveys across military landscapes, contributing high-quality data to a nationwide dataset.
Led independent planning of field sampling schedule, consistently meeting sampling frequency targets ahead of deadlines.
Collaborated with Department of Defense (DoD) natural resource managers, U.S. Fish and Wildlife biologists, non-profit partners, and fellow interns, reporting findings to the U.S. Forest Service and DoD to inform pollinator conservation planning.
Engaged the military community and 10,000+ Environment for the Americas followers in pollinator conservation and monarch biology by creating four blog posts and an infographic that translated complex science into accessible, engaging content.

Tribal Engagement to Develop Culturally Significant Species Monitoring Protocols ᐧ Colorado Natural Heritage Program ᐧ Fort Collins, CO ᐧ Jan-May 2025

Contributed to the Statewide Natural Heritage Survey project during a 16-week applied research capstone to develop pathways for merging Indigenous and Western frameworks on identifying and monitoring species in Colorado conservation efforts.
Managed the development of project deliverables, including a literature review, executive summary, and presentation tailored for stakeholder use.
Presented findings to the Colorado Natural Heritage Program and the Western Natural Heritage Program network, supporting regional knowledge-sharing and policy dialogue.

Aerobiology Research ᐧ Colorado State University OneHealth Institute ᐧ Fort Collins, CO ᐧ May-Aug 2024

Contributed to a National Science Foundation-funded research project on spatial taxa variation in aerial microbes from inception to completion, assisting with study design, field sampling, data analysis, and presentation of findings.
Coordinated and managed multi-site field and lab operations, ensuring timely completion of sampling and data processing benchmarks across project phases.
Synthesized and presented findings at a research conference, demonstrating quantitative conclusions on alpha/beta diversity, bacterial isolate culturing, and soil functional potential across urban and grassland ecosystems.

title: Resume
text:
Sustainability Analysis Experience

Greenhouse Gas Inventory Preparation & Analysis ᐧ Colorado State University ᐧ Fort Collins, CO ᐧ Jan-May 2025

Applied IPCC Guideline-based Tier 1, Tier 2, and Tier 3 emissions estimate methods in AFOLU, energy, and transport sectors in scenario-based projects. 
Authored a comprehensive greenhouse gas inventory to analyze 23-year-long trends in electricity generation emissions in Oregon, producing emissions projections and mitigation scenarios with 95% confidence intervals utilizing Tier 1 IPCC methods. 
Developed mastery in several tools for conducting greenhouse gas inventories, including analysis in ALU and DAYCENT, as well as developing customized R scripts. 

Life Cycle Assessment for Sustainability ᐧ Colorado State University ᐧ Fort Collins, CO ᐧ Aug-Dec 2024

Created a life cycle inventory using USEEIO v2.0 software to draw sustainability conclusions within the 2012 economy. 
Developed a Cradle to Gate life cycle assessment conforming to 2006 ISO 14040 and 14044 standards utilizing OpenLCA software. 
Performed uncertainty and significance analyses to interpret life cycle assessment results, identifying key flows and impact categories driving sustainability outcomes.

title: Clara Jordan
text:
I am a sustainability scientist specialized in carbon management. I am passionate about the intersections between community resilience, global sustainability, and greenhouse gas emissions. My expertise lies in ecosystem mechanisms, sustainability science, and the quantification and mitigation of greenhouse gas emissions in project and corporate settings. My technical skills revolve around greenhouse gas inventory, greenhouse gas accounting, and life cycle assessment for sustainability.
Currently I am pursuing a master of professional science in ecosystem science and sustainability and a graduate certificate in carbon management. I am eager to apply my skills towards making a tangible impact in global sustainable development through greenhouse gas management.
When I’m not thinking about climate I enjoy reading, spending time outdoors, and adventuring.
